image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Hurricane Beryl, churning toward Jamaica, threatens Haiti and Dominican Republic
item.description: Hurricane Beryl, a Category 4 storm, poses a threat to Jamaica, Hispaniola, Haiti's Port-au-Prince, and the Cayman Islands. Prime Minister Ralph Gonsalves reports severe damage on Union Island. Prime Minister Dickon Mitchell emphasizes the destruction on Carriacou and Petite Martinique. Scientist Christopher Rozoff attributes Beryl's rapid intensification to high North Atlantic temperatures.

item.title: Boris Johnson makes surprise late move to avert Tory wipeout
item.description: Boris Johnson made a surprise appearance on Tuesday night to urge Conservative voters to prevent Labour from achieving a landslide victory in the upcoming UK general election. In an unscheduled speech in central London, Johnson, who is not running as a Tory candidate, warned that a Labour government with a significant majority would undo Conservative achievements.

item.title: China is building and testing lethal attack drones for Russia
item.description: Chinese and Russian companies are reportedly developing an attack drone similar to Iran's Shahed model, which has been used in Ukraine, according to European officials. This collaboration began in 2023 and has progressed to development and testing stages, with the intention of shipping the drones to Russia. The Chinese drones have not yet been deployed in Ukraine.

item.title: Russia's Novorossiysk authorities limit beach access after sea drones attacks
item.description: Russia has often accused Ukraine of attacking its port cities on the Black Sea coast and on the Moscow-annexed Crimean Peninsula, but Russian officials often do not disclose the full extent of damage inflicted by Ukrainian attacks.

item.title: Malaysia court dismisses jailed ex-PM Najib's bid to serve sentence under house arrest
item.description: Former PM Najib Razak's bid for house arrest denied by Malaysian court, pushing for execution of royal order in 1MDB scandal case.

item.title: Indian worker bleeds to death in accident on Italian farm, landowner arrested

item.title: Haiti PM vows 'transparency' to population traumatized by gangs
item.description: Garry Conille returns as Haiti's prime minister, pledging transparency and cooperation amid gang violence and infrastructural collapse. With a UN background, he focuses on immediate security with international support while reinforcing local police. Conille aims to rebuild trust, address crises, and organize elections by 2026, emphasizing transparency and structured progress for a successful transition.

Biden moots new rule to safeguard workers from extreme heat

item.title: Salman Rushdie's stabber rejects plea deal involving terrorism charge with lesser jail term
item.description: Hadi Matar, the 26-year-old accused of stabbing author Salman Rushdie in 2022, has declined a plea deal on Tuesday that would have lowered his state prison sentence but could lead to a federal terrorism-related charge, according to his attorney, Nathaniel Barone. Matar remains in custody without bail following the attack that took place as Rushdie was preparing to speak at the Chautauqua Institution in western New York. Rushdie suffered significant injuries, including blindness in one eye and over a dozen stab wounds.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US to announce over $2.3 billion arms package for Ukraine, says defense secretary Austin
item.description: The United States is preparing to announce a new security assistance package for Ukraine worth over $2.3 billion. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin revealed this during a meeting with his Ukrainian counterpart at the Pentagon. The package is in response to persistent calls from Ukrainian officials for more air defense systems due to frequent missile and drone attacks by Russian forces. The new package is expected to include anti-tank weapons, air defense interceptors, and expedited procurement of NASAMS and Patriot air defense interceptors.

item.title: 200 candidates withdraw from French poll to block far-right's win prospect
item.description: At least 200 candidates have exited the French election race to block the far-right party from gaining power, aiming to prevent the splitting of anti-right votes, reported news agency AFP. Marine Le Pen's RN emerged as the frontrunner in the first round of Sunday's snap election, surpassing President Emmanuel Macron's centrist camp, which finished in third place behind a left-wing alliance. Macron's decision to call the early election appears to have backfired. The RN's stance against further EU integration and its plans to reduce funding to the EU have raised concerns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Will Indian diaspora back Rishi Sunak in UK polls?
item.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, who has often looked exhausted as he crossed the country during a six-week campaign, started the penultimate day of campaigning before Thursday's vote in a vast Ocado warehouse in Luton, north of London, watching robots pick items for delivery. Sunak, who shocked many in his party and the country when he called an election several months earlier than expected, has endured a tough campaign, facing questions from voters and journalists as to why the country is not in better shape.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Don't do something you might regret': UK PM's last request to voters ahead of general elections
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan's wife Bushra Bibi gets bail in graft case

item.title: UK court gives mixed ruling in Pfizer vs Moderna COVID vaccine patents case
item.description: London's High Court invalidated one of Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine technology patents, upheld another infringed by Pfizer and BioNTech's Comirnaty vaccine. Global legal battles continue as companies plan to appeal, ensuring vaccine production remains unaffected.

item.title: Fourth of July celebrations: Where to find the best fireworks in Los Angeles
item.description: As the fourth of July approaches, Los Angeles offers numerous prime locations to enjoy breathtaking fireworks. Popular spots include the Rose Bowl, Marina Del Rey, Disneyland, Hollywood Forever Cemetery, Long Beach, Huntington Beach, Universal Studios, and Hollywood Bowl. Each venue features unique celebrations, from soccer games and movie festivals to beach activities and patriotic-themed events, promising a spectacular Independence day experience.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk
